meanings.definition: To undo or remove stitches from (a piece of sewing)
meanings.sent1: She carefully unpicks the crooked stitches on her dress.
meanings.sent2: Mom unpicks the thread to fix the hole in my favorite shirt.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten unpicks the hem of the curtains while playing.
meanings.sent4: His keen eye unpicks the intricate pattern of deception in the suspect's story.
meanings.sent5: With precision, she unpicks the tangled threads, restoring the fabric to its original state.

meanings.definition: To analyze or examine in detail, especially in order to reveal flaws or weaknesses
meanings.sent1: The detective unpicks the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent2: Scientists unpick the data to understand the cause of the phenomenon.
meanings.sent3: The curious child unpicks the toy to see how it works inside.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp mind unpicks the logic behind the complex problem effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Through careful observation, he unpicks the hidden meanings in the ancient text.
